header.headertext: MARSHALLED LIST OF AMENDMENTS TO BE MOVED ON REPORT

text.quote: 1: Clause 1, page 1, line 4, leave out “by 1%”

amendments.proposer: THE LORD BISHOP OF RIPON AND LEEDS

text.quote: 2: Clause 1, page 1, line 4, at end insert “save for the exclusions specified in section (Protecting children’s benefits and tax credits)”

amendments.proposer: THE LORD BISHOP OF RIPON AND LEEDS

text.quote: 3*: Clause 1, page 1, line 5, at end insert—
“(1A) Any mandatory 1% up-rating stipulated in subsection (1) shall not apply—
text.IndentOne: (a) to any components of the employment and support allowance (including personal allowances);
(b) to sums specified in regulations under section 10(3) of the Welfare Reform Act 2012 in respect of an amount to be included under section 10(2) of that Act.”

text.quote: 4: Clause 1, page 2, line 2, at end insert—

“( ) Subsection (1) does not apply in relation to a tax year if, on the review in that tax year under section 150(1) of the Social Security Administration Act 1992, the Secretary of State determines that the general level of prices, measured by the Consumer Price Index, for Great Britain has increased by 3% or more over the period under review.”
5: Clause 1, page 2, line 3, leave out subsection (6)
6*: After Clause 1, insert the following new Clause—
“Statutory maternity pay
text.IndentOne: Any mandatory 1% up-rating stipulated in section 1(1) shall not apply to statutory maternity pay.”

text.quote: 7: Clause 2, page 2, line 19, leave out “by 1%”

amendments.proposer: THE LORD BISHOP OF RIPON AND LEEDS

text.quote: 8: Clause 2, page 2, line 19, at end insert “save for the exclusions specified in section (Protecting children’s benefits and tax credits)”
9: Clause 2, page 2, line 29, at end insert—

“( ) Subsection (1) does not apply in relation to a tax year if, on the review in that tax year under section 41 of the Tax Credits Act 2002, the Treasury determine that the general level of prices, measured by the Consumer Price Index, in the United Kingdom has increased by 3% or more over the period under review.”
10: Clause 2, page 2, line 30, leave out subsection (5)

amendments.proposer: THE LORD BISHOP OF RIPON AND LEEDS

text.quote: 11*: After Clause 2, insert the following new Clause—
“Protecting children’s benefits and tax credits
text.IndentOne: Any mandatory 1% up-rating stipulated in sections 1(1) and 2(1) shall not apply to child benefit, child tax credit, or any amount of universal credit paid on account of having a child in the household.”

text.quote: 12*: After Clause 2, insert the following new Clause—
“Review by the Social Security Advisory Committee
(1) If inflation reaches 3.2% in the relevant period the Secretary of State must instruct the Social Security Advisory Committee to commence a review of the level of up-rating.
(2) For the purposes of subsection (1), inflation is measured by the Consumer Price Index.
(3) The relevant period for subsection (1) shall be each period of 12 months starting on 1 April 2013 and ending on 31 March 2016.
(4) A review under subsection (1) shall include—
text.IndentOne: (a) an analysis of the effects of the increase in inflation on the recipients of the benefits outlined in the Schedule, and

amendments.proposer: THE LORD BISHOP OF RIPON AND LEEDS

text.quote: 13: The Schedule, page 4, line 9, leave out “(i) and”

amendments.proposer: THE LORD BISHOP OF RIPON AND LEEDS

text.quote: 14: The Schedule, page 4, line 26, leave out paragraph (k)
15: The Schedule, page 4, line 41, leave out paragraph (b)
